          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values close friendships.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values close friendships.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub with friends.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.

      Stage index

      How many players acted so far this stage

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering watching a game at a pub and would enjoy the company of William Jones or Alice Lewis, but is content to watch alone or with Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Trustee Circle: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to watch it with.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to watch it with.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game and who to watch it with.

          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Context for action selection and components

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

Alexander White just arrived.
          Trustee Circle: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a picnic with friends and deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he and his friends decided to sneak into The Black Swan after closing hours. The thrill of the forbidden and the allure of the dimly lit pub proved too tempting to resist. As they huddled in a corner booth, listening to the lingering echoes of music and sharing stolen sips of ale, Alexander felt a surge of exhilaration, a sense of belonging that transcended the recklessness of their actions.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, his father passed away suddenly from a heart attack. The news hit Alexander like a physical blow, leaving him reeling with grief and a profound sense of loss. He found solace in the familiar warmth of The Black Swan, surrounded by the comforting presence of his friends, their shared laughter and stories a temporary balm to his aching heart.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, his father passed away suddenly from a heart attack. The news hit Alexander like a physical blow, leaving him reeling with grief and a profound sense of loss. He found solace in the familiar warmth of The Black Swan, surrounded by the comforting presence of his friends, their shared laughter and stories a temporary balm to his aching heart.

        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he and his friends decided to sneak into The Black Swan after closing hours. The thrill of the forbidden and the allure of the dimly lit pub proved too tempting to resist. As they huddled in a corner booth, listening to the lingering echoes of music and sharing stolen sips of ale, Alexander felt a surge of exhilaration, a sense of belonging that transcended the recklessness of their actions.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, his father passed away suddenly from a heart attack. The news hit Alexander like a physical blow, leaving him reeling with grief and a profound sense of loss. He found solace in the familiar warmth of The Black Swan, surrounded by the comforting presence of his friends, their shared laughter and stories a temporary balm to his aching heart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a picnic with friends and deciding where to watch a football game later.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning where to watch the Andorra vs Portugal game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Trustee Circle: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.

She had written a song, a raw outpouring of teenage angst and longing, but fear choked her voice, preventing her from joining her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, who were performing their usual raucous rock set. She watched them from the shadows, a silent observer, the melody of her own unspoken song echoing in her chest.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Trustee Circle: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely try to find a compromise that satisfies everyone in the group, as he values spending time with his friends and wants them all to have a good time.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.

Jack, who had been practicing for months and still struggled with parallel parking, felt a familiar pang of envy. He forced a smile, congratulating Alice, but inside, he couldn't shake the feeling that he was somehow falling behind.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and later that evening, he and his friends are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest The Crooked Billet as the ideal place to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he convinced his friends Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William to sneak into The Crooked Billet after hours. They hid in the back room, listening to the owner, a gruff but kind man named Mr. Higgins, tell stories of the pub's history. The thrill of being somewhere forbidden, of hearing secrets whispered in the darkness, ignited a spark in Jacob that he couldn't ignore.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a unique and quirky atmosphere.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and later that evening will be watching the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          Trustee Circle: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a location that is convenient for the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a friendly and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a location that is convenient for the group.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

        • Jack Taylor

          • Jack Taylor

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and later plans to watch a soccer game with them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub to watch the upcoming football game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in Victoria Park and later plans to watch a soccer game with them.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to enjoy the sunshine with friends. Later that evening, he and his friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          Trustee Circle: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor. He has a preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, but is willing to compromise to be with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor. He has a preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, but is willing to compromise to be with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that allows him to watch the game with his friends while still getting to enjoy his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor. He has a preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, but is willing to compromise to be with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to enjoy the sunshine with friends. Later that evening, he and his friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor. He has a preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, but is willing to compromise to be with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.
