2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          Trustee Circle: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon at Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends are planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with her close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        TrusteeCircle
      • Trustee Circle
          Key
        • Trustee Circle
          Trusted agents
        • Alice Lewis
          Circle state
          • Alice Lewis
          • 3
            3
            3

            3

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends in Victoria Park and watching football games at pubs, particularly The Crooked Billet. He values Jacob Walker's company and appreciates a lively atmosphere.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Crooked Billet as the pub to watch the game at.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.

          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends in Victoria Park and watching football games at pubs, particularly The Crooked Billet. He values Jacob Walker's company and appreciates a lively atmosphere.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a bustling market where he is with friends, and later that night he plans to watch a soccer game with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to find a compromise that allows him to watch the game with his friends while still getting to enjoy his preferred pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub and he prefers to watch games there with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Trustee Circle: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor. He has a preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, but is willing to compromise to be with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the atmosphere, chatting with his friends, and perhaps sampling some of the market's offerings.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.

          Answer: Alexander White just arrived at a bustling market where he is with friends, and later that night he plans to watch a soccer game with them.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly Jack Taylor. He has a preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, but is willing to compromise to be with his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social setting, enjoying time with friends at a market.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alexander White is currently in a trustee circle with Alexander White. Alexander White must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the atmosphere, chatting with his friends, and perhaps sampling some of the market's offerings.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. While he has preferences for certain pubs and company, he ultimately values the experience of watching the game regardless of the location or who else is present.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Crooked Billet.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends. He values the experience of watching the game more than the specific location or company.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends. He values the experience of watching the game more than the specific location or company.
          Final chain of thought

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
      William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a bustling market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. They are deciding where to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Trustee Circle: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding on plans for the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a location that is convenient for the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding on plans for the evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding on plans for the evening.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Jack Taylor is currently in a trustee circle with Jack Taylor. Jack Taylor must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest a pub that everyone agrees on, prioritizing a location that is convenient for the group.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        TrusteeCircle
      • Trustee Circle
          Key
        • Trustee Circle
          Trusted agents
        • Jack Taylor
          Circle state
          • Jack Taylor
          • 3

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
      William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where she is with friends, discussing where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Trustee Circle: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values close friendships.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values close friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          {DEFAULT_OBSERVATION_TRUSTEES_PRE_ACT_KEY}: Alice Lewis is currently in a trustee circle with Alice Lewis. Alice Lewis must be willing to cooperate and make concessions with them in the future to reach a bigger objective.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a compromise, perhaps a pub that is a reasonable distance from the park and also appeals to the group.

        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        TrusteeCircle
      • Trustee Circle
          Key
        • Trustee Circle
          Trusted agents
        • Alice Lewis
          Circle state
          • Alice Lewis
          • 3

            3

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, how about we watch the game at The Crooked Billet? They've got great beer and it's always a good time there.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion isn't too far, and they have a nice garden.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion's a good shout, nice garden and decent beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet is the only sensible choice.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where to watch the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. Nowhere else will do.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is always a good shout.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a bit far, isn't it? Maybe somewhere closer to here?
      William Jones -- "I'm with Jacob, The Crooked Billet is the place to be.
      Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
      William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Anyone fancy trying one of those pastries? They smell amazing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, anyone up for The Crooked Billet tonight? They've got a good atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet was good last time, maybe we should go there again?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Crooked Billet is a good shout, but maybe somewhere a bit closer to the park?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently at a market with friends, discussing where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, deciding with friends where to watch a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest a pub to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "We should go to The Crooked Billet. It's the only place to watch the game.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    William Jones -- premise: Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
    William Jones -- premise: It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about Alexander White being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jack Taylor and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and William Jones to bond over their shared passion.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: It would mean a lot to Jacob Walker if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet pub with his friends and is looking forward to Alexander White's company.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could leave for The Crooked Billet pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to leave for The Crooked Billet pub.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)
